text.name: sys_description
text.text: The BBC Micro is a series of microcomputers designed by Acorn Electronics in 1981. It spearheaded the computer literacy project launched by the BBC following a documentary in which Dr. Christopher Evans predicts the coming of the computer revolution and its impact on the UK. Model A was equipped with a MOS 6502 CPU at 2MHz, 16KB of upgradeable RAM and 4-channel mono sound with voice synthesis. It could display a resolution up to 640x256 in 16 colors. Many models would be released improving its capabilities.
